inputs.remark:
Ordered list 缺少 Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)，MRI of internal auditory canal，electroacoustic verification，Aided COSI
修改：V1 → V2(新增) → V3(原V2) → V4(原V3) → V5(新增)
V2: Medical Evaluation - Otology（新增）
V5: 2-Week Follow-up Assessment（新增）
需新增 V2: Medical Evaluation 包含测试：
  1) ABR - 结果：waves I-V latencies normal bilaterally, 90 dBnHL, no dysfunction
  2) MRI - 结果：normal internal auditory canals bilaterally, clear of pathology
V4(原V3)缺少3项测试：electroacoustic verification，Directional microphone verification，RESR90
V5: 2-Week Follow-up Assessment 缺少：Aided COSI，Aided QuickSIN，2cc coupler measurement

logic_summary: Added missing items to ordered_list: ABR, MRI, Electroacoustic verification, Aided COSI.
Restructured visits: V1 (Initial), V2 (New Medical Eval), V3 (Old V2), V4 (Old V3), V5 (New Follow-up).
Added ABR and MRI results to new V2.
Added Electroacoustic verification, Directional microphone verification, and RESR90 to V4 (formerly V3).
Added Aided COSI, Aided QuickSIN, and 2cc coupler measurement to new V5.

value.rationale_short: To ensure hearing aids meet manufacturer specifications.
To assess subjective benefit with hearing aids.

value.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation revealed bilateral asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss, worse in the left ear, with high-frequency sloping configuration. Middle ear function was normal. Acoustic reflexes were elevated or absent, consistent with the degree of loss or potential retrocochlear pathology. The asymmetry and unilateral symptoms (tinnitus, fullness) constitute red flags requiring medical referral.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Normal sloping to moderately severe SNHL. Left: Normal sloping to severe SNHL. Asymmetric configuration.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT aligned with PTA. WRS excellent in Right (92%) and good in Left (80%).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral normal to absent; Contralateral mostly absent. Consistent with cochlear loss or retrocochlear pathology.

value.collective_interpretation: Medical evaluation performed by Otology to rule out retrocochlear pathology. ABR and MRI were ordered and results were normal. Patient cleared for amplification.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: waves I-V latencies normal bilaterally, 90 dBnHL, no dysfunction

tests.name: MRI of internal auditory canal
tests.result_summary: normal internal auditory canals bilaterally, clear of pathology

value.collective_interpretation: Patient returned after medical clearance (normal MRI and ABR). Pre-fitting evaluation showed a moderate SNR loss on QuickSIN, suggesting hearing aids alone may be insufficient in noise. LDLs were normal, and COSI goals were established focusing on TV, restaurants, and grandchildren.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDLs)
tests.result_summary: Normal range at all frequencies tested.

tests.name: Self-report scale
tests.result_summary: COSI goals: Hearing wife in restaurants, hearing grandchildren, hearing TV.

value.collective_interpretation: Hearing aid fitting performed with bilateral RIC devices. Real-ear measures verified gain to NAL-NL2 targets. Aided loudness judgments confirmed appropriate perception of soft, comfortable, and loud sounds. Verification of electroacoustic performance and directional microphones was completed.

tests.name: Real-Ear Measures (REM)
tests.result_summary: Verified to NAL-NL2 targets; inputs 50, 65, 80 dB SPL provided appropriate gain.

tests.name: Aided Loudness Judgments
tests.result_summary: Patient rated speech signals appropriately (Soft, Comfortable, Loud but okay).

tests.name: RESR90
tests.result_summary: Performed at 90 dB SPL; patient did not report loudness discomfort.

value.collective_interpretation: Two-week follow-up assessment. Patient reported doing well but still having difficulty in noise. Adjustments were made to high-frequency gain and noise reduction. Aided testing demonstrated significant improvement.

tests.name: Aided COSI
tests.result_summary: Patient reported hearing 'better' or 'much better' in listening environments compared to unaided.

tests.name: Aided QuickSIN
tests.result_summary: SNR Loss of 6 dB (mild loss), significantly improved from 14 dB unaided.

tests.name: 2cc coupler measurement
tests.result_summary: Electroacoustic analysis performed at user settings to serve as a baseline.
